results.title: Jilted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Jenny Day and Mermaid Beach Productions
results.brief_description: Set around a tropical island resort where Al works trying to escape his past, and where Harriet is running from a failed marriage. Both hurt in the past, they become involved - until disturbed by the arrival of another woman. Cast includes Richard Moir, Jennifer Cluff, Steve Jacobs, Tina Bursill and Helen Mutkins.

results.title: Jill Bilcock: Dancing the Invisible
results.brief_description: Axel Grigor’s hugely entertaining documentary traces Jill Bilcock’s journey from Melbourne film student in the 1960s to working as an extra in Bollywood movies and learning her craft when Australia had virtually no feature film industry.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.description: With credits including Strictly Ballroom, Muriel’s Wedding, The Dish, Moulin Rouge!, Romeo + Juliet and Road to Perdition, Jill Bilcock is regarded as one the world’s great film editors. Axel Grigor’s hugely entertaining documentary traces Bilcock’s journey from Melbourne film student in the 1960s to working as an extra in Bollywood movies and learning her craft when Australia had virtually no feature film industry. Bilcock’s cheeky charm and illuminating appearances by key collaborators make this a must-see for film lovers.
description_for_label: With credits including Strictly Ballroom, Muriel’s Wedding, The Dish, Moulin Rouge!, Romeo + Juliet and Road to Perdition, Jill Bilcock is regarded as one the world’s great film editors. Axel Grigor’s hugely entertaining documentary traces Bilcock’s journey from Melbourne film student in the 1960s to working as an extra in Bollywood movies and learning her craft when Australia had virtually no feature film industry. Bilcock’s cheeky charm and illuminating appearances by key collaborators make this a must-see for film lovers.

results.title: Spotlights: Jill Bilcock
results.brief_description: An Australian film editor, a member of the Australian Screen Editors guild, as well as the American Cinema Editors society, who has edited films such as Romeo + Juliet (1996), Moulin Rouge! (2001) and Road to Perdition (2002).

constellations_primary.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_primary.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.description:
Jill Bilcock is an Australian film editor, a member of the Australian Screen Editors guild, as well as the American Cinema Editors society, who has edited films such as Romeo + Juliet (1996), Moulin Rouge! (2001) and Road to Perdition (2002). Jill discusses the editing process and the physicality of rushes, now lost in the digital age.

To find our more about Jill Bilcock, rent Jill Bilcock: Dancing the Invisible on our streaming platform, Cinema 3.
description_for_label: Jill Bilcock is an Australian film editor, a member of the Australian Screen Editors guild, as well as the American Cinema Editors society, who has edited films such as Romeo + Juliet (1996), Moulin Rouge! (2001) and Road to Perdition (2002). Jill discusses the editing process and the physicality of rushes, now lost in the digital age.

results.title: Jidi
results.creator_credit: Stephen Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Stephen Pascoe’s grandfather was diagnosed with cancer, he and his sister decided to preserve his memories by filming an interview with him.

results.title: Jhaoo Chowdhari: a Tongawallah from Delhi
results.creator_credit: Yavar Abbas and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Faces of India series. Shows intimate details of family life of a Delhi tradesman and of the district around his home. We see his wives and daughters occupied in housework and in caring for the all important horses, which pull the tonga which is Jhaoo’s livelihood. Also shows sacred shrines never before filmed. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: JGLING/Whistling
results.brief_description:
JGLING:
Close up low-angle shots of a juggler in action bring the viewer right inside the circle of flying objects.

This short video captures the almost hypnotic appeal of watching a skilled juggler at work; the visual rhythms, the ever changing patterns, and the pleasurable anticipation of collapse.

THE FIRST INTERNATIONAL WHISTLING CONTEST:
The First International Whistling Contest was held in Carson, Nevada, 1978. This documentary captures the sweet sounds and light-hearted atmosphere of the day. The participating whistlers not only perform a range of tunes in a variety of styles, from the classical to the comic, but also share details of their technique.
From the man who whistles with a bunch of cigars and cutlery in his mouth, to the woman who claims she could have had a career at Disney animation because, “You can’t hardly get a bird to whistle when you want to”, these characters and their talents are showcased in a style that is immediate, fresh and breezy.

Director Skip Blumberg was a founding member of Videofreex, one of the many alternative media collectives (such as Raindance, Global Village, Ant Farm and TVTV) that blossomed in the 1970s in response to the development of relatively cheap and portable video systems such as Sony’s Portapak. This new technology was embraced both by artists interested in its aesthetic properties and activists inspired by its potential as a tool of political and social change, enabling individuals access to mass communication via cable television and community media networks.

results.title: JFK: Director's cut; Beyond JFK: the question of the conspiracy (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho and Ixtlan Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring Kevin Costner, Joe Pesci, Tommy Lee Jones and Gary Oldman, JFK also features an extensive gallery of appearances by acclaimed actors including Ed Asner, Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon and Donald Sutherland. This release has an additional 17 minutes of footage, providing more excitement, intrigue and insight into Jim Garrison’s turbulent investigation of President John F. Kennedy’s assassination. “Beyond JFK: the question of conspiracy” is a ninety minute documentary re-examining the issues raised by the film and features interviews with persons involved in the Garrison investigation plus astonishing eyewitness accounts. Includes Jim Garrison’s last recorded interview prior to his death.

Includes Jim Garrison’s last recorded interview before he died.

results.title: Jezebel
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On the eve of the Civil War, Julie Marston, a wilful southern belle, does everything in her spiteful power to goad her fiance into a jealous rage. When he is stricken by the plague, she reforms and tries to atone her wicked and sinful ways. Starring Henry Fonda and Bette Davis in her second Best Actress Academy Award performance. Based on the play by Owen Davis Sr.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Wyler, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Jewels of the Kimberley
results.creator_credit: Mitch Matthews, Rio and Rhonda Mabey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The original jewels in the Kimberley in Australia’s far north west were the hardy pioneer cattlemen and women who crossed the Continent with their herds to establish themselves as Kings in Grass Castles. They were followed by gold prospectors and farmers who opened up the mighty Ord River Irrigation Scheme. The newest jewels are diamonds. They were discovered by the new prospectors who are now reaping rich rewards for the millions of dollars they spent prospecting for their jewels. Rated: G
